#Load the libraries
library(raster)
library(sp)
library(spData)
library(tidyverse)
library(sf)
library(dplyr)

#Load in the world data
data(world)  #load 'world' data from spData package

#Remove Antarctica
antarctica <- filter(world, subregion != "Antarctica")
world$subregion

as(world, "Spatial")

#Prepping Climate data
tmax_monthly <- getData(name = "worldclim", var="tmax", res=10)
tmax_monthly
plot(tmax_monthly)

#Setting Gain
gain(tmax_monthly) <- .1  
plot(tmax_monthly)

#Creating tmax_annual
tmax_annual <- max(tmax_monthly) 
names(tmax_annual) <- "tmax" 

#Calculating maximum temperature
country_temp <- raster::extract(tmax_annual, antarctica, fun=max, na.rm=T, small=T, sp=T)
country_temp = st_as_sf(country_temp)


#Plot the results
ggplot(country_temp) + geom_sf(aes(fill = tmax)) + 
scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Annual\nMaximum\nTemperature (C)")+
theme(legend.position = "bottom")

#Create table
library(dplyr)
hottest_country = country_temp %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  top_n(tmax, n=1) %>%
  select(name_long, continent, tmax) %>%
  arrange(desc(tmax)) %>%
  st_set_geometry(NULL)

hottest_country
